notes: Post Cycle 7: BMI (dbar_t<1) FALSIFIED — 12 violations, worst 1.739 (Reg_100_d10 eps=0.5). K_n extremality also falsified (max ratio 2.28). Construction still works: 0 skips in 148 runs. Gap promoted from BMI to No-Skip/GPL-V (vertex-level feasibility). Proof critical path simplified: Turan -> induced Foster -> dbar0<1 -> [No-Skip] -> size.

nodes.body_text: Does there exist universal c>0 such that for every finite undirected graph G=(V,E,w) with nonnegative weights and every epsilon in (0,1), there exists S subseteq V with |S|>=c*epsilon*|V| and L_{G[S]}~ <= epsilon*L_G on R^V?
Laplacian decomposes edge-by-edge: L = sum L_e. Condition L_S <= epsilon*L means internal edges are spectrally dominated. In effective-resistance frame: ||L^{+/2} L_S L^{+/2}|| <= epsilon.
K_n tight example: induced K_s has max eigenvalue s. Condition reduces to s <= epsilon*n. Max epsilon-light subset: floor(epsilon*n), giving c = 1.

Section 5a: Heavy edge pruning via Turan. Edges with tau_e > epsilon are heavy. At most (n-1)/epsilon heavy edges. Turan gives independent set I_0 >= epsilon*n/3 in the heavy graph. All edges internal to I_0 are light (tau_e <= epsilon).

Section 5b DELETED (Cycle 3 Q1): Leverage degree filter is unnecessary. Foster's theorem controls avg leverage degree globally. Removing the filter improves the constant from |I_0'| >= eps*n/12 to |I_0| >= eps*n/3 (4x improvement).

Section 5c: Barrier greedy on I_0. Maintain M_t = sum X_e prec epsilon*I. At each step, need exists v in R_t with ||Y_t(v)|| < 1 where Y_t(v) = H_t^{-1/2} C_t(v) H_t^{-1/2}. Runs for T = epsilon*m_0/3 steps.
Section 5d: Pigeonhole + PSD trace bound. For PSD Y: ||Y|| <= tr(Y). Define dbar = (1/r_t) sum tr(Y_t(v)). By pigeonhole: min tr(Y_t(v)) <= dbar. If dbar < 1 then exists v with ||Y_t(v)|| < 1.

Section 5e (Foster mechanism): Foster's theorem gives sum tau_e = n-1. At M_t = 0: dbar^0 = tr(F_t)/(eps*r_t). CORRECTION (C5): dbar^0 <= 2/3 is NOT universal — max observed dbar^0 = 0.755 (ExpanderProxy_Reg_100_d6, eps=0.5, t=16). For K_n: dbar^0 = 2t/(n*eps) = 2/3 at horizon (exact). The Foster bound tr(F) <= n-1 is too loose by ~factor n; it ignores R-internal leverage L_R.

corrections.dbar0_leq_2_3: FALSE — max observed 0.755 (C5 data, 678 steps, 15 families)
corrections.foster_bound_too_loose: tr(F) <= n-1 ignores that most leverage stays in R-internal edges

nodes.body_text: Section 5e (K_n exact formula, Cycle 2): d_bar_Kn(t) = (t-1)/(m_0*eps - t) + (t+1)/(m_0*eps). At horizon T = eps*m_0/3: d_bar -> 5/6 = 0.833 < 1.

K_n extremality: FALSIFIED (Cycle 7). Max ratio dbar/dbar_Km = 2.28 (base), 1.21 (adversarial). K_n gives LOWEST dbar among graphs with same parameters (BR4 predicted this: convexity of amplification). Prior C2 claim 'max ratio 1.005' was on small graphs (n<=80).

codex_c7_signals.kn_is_minimum: K_n is the EASIEST case (lowest dbar), not hardest

nodes.body_text: Section 5f: Size bound. |S| = T = eps*m_0/3 >= eps^2*n/9. eps^2 structural (Star breaks without Turan).

GPL-H gap: Prove dbar < 1 for general G. REFORMULATED (C5): threshold relaxed from rho_1<1/2 to rho_1<1; alpha<1 proved; remaining gap is dbar0<1. Assembly: dbar = dbar0 + (alpha*dbar0)*x/(1-x). With dbar0<1 and alpha<1, the assembly gives dbar<1 via the product bound.

attack_path_status.b_rho1_lt_half: BLOCKED (BR1-BR4: standard toolkit insufficient at 1/2 threshold)
attack_path_status.c_threshold_relaxation: PROVED — any c<1 suffices in assembly (houseboat)

nodes.body_text: Neumann series attack: B_t = sum M_t^k/eps^{k+1}. Define rho_k = tr(M^k F)/(||M||^k tr(F)). If rho_k <= 1/2 then dbar <= dbar^0 * (2-x)/(2(1-x)) where x=||M||/eps.

PROVED (Cycle 4): rho_k <= rho_1 for all k >= 1 (monotonicity). Proof: rho_k = sum lambda_i^k F_ii/tr(F) with lambda_i = mu_i/||M|| in [0,1]. Since lambda^{k+1} <= lambda^k, rho_{k+1} <= rho_k. Reduces problem to bounding rho_1 only.

PROVED (Cycle 4): rho_1 <= sum mu_i(1-mu_i)/(mu_max*tr(F)) = alpha (operator bound). Proof: F+M<=Pi gives M^{1/2}FM^{1/2} <= M-M^2, so tr(MF) <= tau - ||M||_F^2. For K_n: bound = (t-1)/(2t) < 1/2 (PROVED). Max over all tested: 0.494 (K_n extremal).

RESOLVED (Codex C3): tr(F_t) = 2(t-tau) is FALSE (error=12 on Star_40). Correct identity: tr(F_t) = sum_{u in S} ell_u - 2*tau (to machine precision). Original proof route via (t-tau)/tr(F) < 1/2 BLOCKED. Replaced by operator bound route.

SUPERSEDED (Cycle 5): The alpha<1/2 trace gap is no longer the bottleneck. Threshold relaxation shows c<1 suffices (not c<1/2). With alpha<1 proved and product bound alpha*dbar0<=1/3, the remaining gap is dbar0<1 (see p6-dbar0-gap). The original formulation (tr(F) > 2*sum mu_i(1-mu_i)/mu_max) is blocked by BR1-BR4 at the 1/2 threshold.

PROVED (Cycle 4): Four blocking results show standard spectral toolkit cannot close GPL-H at the 1/2 threshold. BR1: abstract PSD (M,F with M+F<=I) can have alpha=1. BR2: per-edge alignment alpha_{uv} -> 1/2 on K_n as n->inf. BR3: interlacing fails — avg char poly Q not real-rooted at 35/117 steps. BR4: Schur-convexity reverses — concentrated eigenvalues give HIGHER dbar than uniform, contradicting K_n extremality.

PROVED (Cycle 5): alpha = tr(P_M F)/tr(F) < 1 for vertex-induced partitions whenever cross-edges exist. Proof: For cross edge (u,v) with u in S, v in R, incidence vector b_uv has nonzero coordinate on v not in S. No S-internal edge involves v, so b_uv not in span of internal incidence vectors. L^{+/2} injective on im(L), so z_uv not in col(M). Hence ||P_{M^perp} z_uv||^2 > 0 for each cross edge, giving tr((I-P_M)F) > 0. ESSENTIAL: vertex-induced structure required — random edge partitions can give alpha=1.

PROVED (Cycle 5): The 1/2 threshold in rho_1 < 1/2 is NOT fundamental. Assembly dbar <= dbar0*(1-x+cx)/(1-x) gives dbar<1 for any c<1 when dbar0<1 and x<1. Need c < c_needed = (1-x)(1/dbar0-1)/x. Empirically: min c_needed=0.957, max rho1=0.494, so uniform c0 in (0.494,0.957) exists. Transforms problem from tight inequality (8% margin) to qualitative statement.

PROVED (Cycle 5): alpha*dbar0 = tr(P_M F)/(r*eps) <= ((t-1)-tau)/(r*eps). Empirically max 0.328 across 678 steps (tight at K_n: alpha*dbar0 -> 1/3). Controls the Neumann correction: dbar = dbar0 + (alpha*dbar0)*x/(1-x). Key structural insight: when dbar0 is high, alpha is low (complementarity).

PROVED (Cycle 5): dbar = dbar0 + (alpha*dbar0)*x/(1-x). Decomposes Neumann amplification into base (dbar0) + correction (product bound). Assembly dbar<1 verified at all 678 steps (max 0.833 = 5/6 at K_n). With dbar0<1 and product bound, assembly closes.

REMAINING GAP (Cycle 5): Prove dbar0 = tr(F)/(r*eps) < 1 at all barrier greedy steps for all graphs. Equivalently: E[cut edges in uniform spanning tree] < r*eps. Equivalently: R-internal leverage L_R > n-1-tau-r*eps. Foster bound alone gives dbar0 <= (n-1)/(r*eps), too loose by ~factor n. Empirically: max dbar0 = 0.755 (margin 24.5%). K_n: dbar0 = 2/3 at horizon.

reformulations.leverage: avg cross-edge leverage per R-vertex < eps

nodes.body_text: K_n: PROVED, c=1/3. General: ONE GAP — No-Skip/GPL-V (vertex-level feasibility). BMI (dbar<1) FALSIFIED (C7, worst 1.739). Proof chain: Turan -> sort by ell^{I_0} -> modified greedy -> [NO-SKIP GAP] + induced Foster -> dbar0<1 (PROVED for prefix) -> eps^2*n/9.

PROVED (Cycle 6): Induced Foster bound. sum_{e in E(I_0)} tau_e <= m-1 where m=|I_0|. Proof: Rayleigh monotonicity gives R_eff^{G[I_0]}(u,v) >= R_eff^G(u,v), so tau_e^{subgraph} >= tau_e^G. Foster for G[I_0] gives sum tau_e^{subgraph} = m-kappa. Hence sum tau_e^G <= m-1. Corollary: sum ell_v^{I_0} <= 2(m-1).

PROVED (Cycle 6): For the pure prefix S = {v_1,...,v_t} sorted by ell_v^{I_0} nondecreasing, with t <= eps*m/3: dbar0 <= 2t(m-1)/(m*r*eps) <= 2(m-1)/(m(3-eps)) < 2/(3-eps) < 1. Uses induced Foster (sum ell^{I_0} <= 2(m-1)) + partial averages (prefix sum <= t*total/m). This is the BASE component of the barrier degree — the M=0 version.

CONSTRUCTION B (Cycle 6): Modified leverage-order barrier greedy. Sort I_0 by ell_v^{I_0} nondecreasing. Process in order, add v iff barrier-feasible (||Y_t(v)||<1) and |S|<T. Codex C6 results: reaches horizon in ALL 116 runs. ZERO skips — trajectory IS the pure prefix. Worst dbar0 = 0.7333 (27% margin). Bridge A (standard greedy) DEAD: 187 partial-averages violations.

FALSIFIED (Cycle 7): BMI (dbar_t<1) is FALSE. 12 base-suite steps have dbar>=1 (worst 1.739, Reg_100_d10 eps=0.5 t=16). K_n extremality also falsified (max ratio dbar/dbar_Km = 2.28). The pigeonhole route (dbar<1 -> exists feasible v) is dead. Prior 'dbar<1 at ALL steps' claims were based on dbar0 (not full dbar) or smaller graph suites.

REMAINING GAP (Cycle 7): Vertex-Level Feasibility (GPL-V). At each step t of Construction B, EXISTS v in R_t with ||Y_t(v)||<1. Replaces BMI (now falsified). Cannot use pigeonhole (dbar>1). No-Skip (NEXT v feasible) also weakened: 5/116 runs have skips with strict threshold. GPL-V only requires SOME feasible v exists. Evidence: construction completes in 148/148 runs, max selected normY=0.954.
nodes.status: OPEN — the true remaining gap (replaces p6-bmi-gap)

nodes.body_text: Bridge C (Cycle 6): Direct induction on dbar0. Delta_t = ell_v^{R_{t+1}} - ell_v^{S_t} < rhs_t = (r_t-1)*eps - tr(F_t) gives dbar0_{t+1}<1. Numerically verified at ALL 726 steps (0 failures). For pure prefix with large m (m > (6+eps)/(eps*(1-eps))): PROVED formally. But Bridge C only establishes dbar0<1, not the full BMI (dbar<1).

FIXED (Cycle 6): Strict-light threshold. Heavy := tau_e >= eps (not just >). Fixes K_10 knife-edge where tau_e = eps exactly gave dbar0 = 1.0. With strict threshold: K_10 eps=0.2 has I_0=1 vertex, T=0 (vacuously true). Exhaustive small-n scan: 0 cases with dbar0>=1.

edges.evidence: Rewrite condition in effective-resistance frame
K_n tight example: s <= epsilon*n, c = 1
Heavy/light split, Turan independent set I_0 >= eps*n/3
Leverage filter unnecessary. 4x constant improvement.
Barrier greedy runs on I_0 directly
If dbar < 1 then exists v with ||Y_t(v)|| < 1
Foster controls dbar^0. CORRECTED: dbar^0 <= 2/3 NOT universal (max 0.755).
K_n exact formula d_bar -> 5/6 at horizon
Empirical: d_bar_G/d_bar_Kn <= 1.005
Neumann amplification bound for dbar
rho_k <= rho_1 for all k: suffices to bound rho_1
rho_1 <= (tau-||M||^2_F)/(mu_max*tr(F)) via F+M<=Pi operator inequality
For K_n: operator bound = (t-1)/(2t) < 1/2 (proved exactly)
tr(F)=2(t-tau) is FALSE. Original rho proof route blocked. Replaced by operator bound.
SUPERSEDED: alpha<1/2 no longer bottleneck after threshold relaxation
SUPERSEDED by threshold relaxation + dbar0 gap
BR1-BR4 block standard toolkit at 1/2 threshold. Motivates threshold relaxation.
Four blocking results close the rho_1<1/2 route for standard spectral tools
alpha<1 proved via coordinate argument (vertex-induced structure essential)
c<1 suffices in assembly: transforms problem from tight inequality to qualitative statement
Bypasses BR1-BR4 by relaxing from 1/2 to 1 threshold
alpha*dbar0 <= ((t-1)-tau)/(r*eps) <= 1/3 (K_n tight)
dbar = dbar0 + (alpha*dbar0)*x/(1-x): correction controlled by product bound
Decomposes Neumann series into base (dbar0) + correction (product bound)
Closing dbar0<1 would close GPL-H via the assembly decomposition
The true remaining gap: prove dbar0 = tr(F)/(r*eps) < 1
K_n PROVED. General: one gap (dbar0<1).
K_n closed via exact formula
General graphs conditional on BMI closure
Induced Foster: sum tau_e over E(I_0) <= m-1 via Rayleigh monotonicity
Prefix dbar0 < 2/(3-eps) < 1 via induced Foster + partial averages
dbar0<1 PROVED for the prefix. Gap refined from dbar0<1 to BMI (full dbar<1).
Modified greedy: sort by ell^{I_0}, add if feasible. Replaces standard barrier greedy.
Modified greedy produces pure prefix (0 skips), enabling conditional dbar0 proof
Refined gap: BMI (full dbar<1) replaces dbar0<1 (now proved for prefix)
Assembly dbar = dbar0 + correction diverges as x->1. Complementarity gap.
Direct induction: Delta_t < rhs_t gives dbar0_{t+1}<1. Proved for prefix (large m).
Heavy := tau_e >= eps (strict light). Fixes K_10 knife-edge.
BMI falsified (C7). Gap promoted from average (dbar<1) to individual (No-Skip: ||Y_t(v)||<1 for leverage-ordered v).
No-Skip is the single remaining gap for Construction B. Must prove vertex-level feasibility directly, not via averaging.

hx/content.evidence: Core proof chain (unchanged). Step 5a Foster corrected: dbar0<=2/3 not universal.
Neumann -> monotonicity -> operator bound -> alpha<1/2 gap. BLOCKED by BR1-BR4. Superseded by relaxation chain.
Blocking -> relax threshold -> alpha<1 -> product bound -> assembly -> [dbar0<1 gap] -> GPL-H. All steps proved except dbar0<1.
Bridge B chain (revised C7): Turan -> induced Foster -> dbar0<1 (PROVED) -> modified greedy -> [No-Skip GAP] -> size. Dead branch: alpha<1 -> assembly -> BMI (FALSIFIED) -> pigeonhole (unreachable).

refined_cycle6: p6-dbar0-gap -> p6-bmi-gap (dbar0<1 proved, refined to full dbar<1)
refined_cycle7: p6-bmi-gap -> p6-gpl-v (BMI falsified, gap promoted to vertex-level feasibility)

empirical_summary.test_suite_c5: 678 steps, 15 graph families, n up to 500
